newsitem.title: USA: Pfizer to sponsor major heart drug trial.
newsitem.headline: Pfizer to sponsor major heart drug trial.

text.p: Pfizer Inc on Tuesday said it will sponsor a major European clinical trial involving 18,000 patients to compare the effectiveness of new hypertension drugs against older therapies.

The goal of the trial -- one of the largest hypertension studies ever -- is to show reduced rates of heart attacks and strokes in patients using new drugs to control high blood pressure, the company said. The Pfizer drug Norvasc will be included in the study.

Pfizer said the five-year study, dubbed the Anglo-Scandinavian Cardiac Outcomes Trial, will involve patients recruited by family physicians in six countries -- Britain, Ireland, Sweded, Finland, Norway and Denmark.
Pfizer is spending $55 million on the study, it said.
A secondary goal of the study is to compare healthcare costs for patients treated with newer agents to the costs for those using older therapies, Pfizer said.
The trial will also study the effects of using Norvasc for hypertension in combination with the drug Lipitor for high cholesterol.
